Package lab7

Class AutoShop

java.lang.Object
lab7.AutoShop
public class AutoShop extends Object
A class representing a auto shop that has an owner . An auto shop owns a collection (or possibly collections) of vehicles.

Only the owner of the auto shop is able to sell vehicles from the auto shop.

ASSUMPTION: each vehicle in the auto shop is unique, i.e., the auto shop does NOT have two vehicles that are equal to each other (see the equal() method of the Vehicle class for definition of "equal"). See the docstring of the add() method to see what should happen when adding a duplicate vehicle.

  • Constructor Details

    • AutoShop

      public AutoShop(ShopOwner owner)
      Initializes this auto shop so that it has the specified owner and no vehicles.
      Parameters:
      owner - the owner of this auto shop

    • AutoShop

      public AutoShop(AutoShop other)
      Initializes this auto shop by copying another auto shop. This auto shop will have the same owner and the same number and type of vehicles as the other auto shop.
      Parameters:
      other - the auto shop to copy

  • Method Details

    • changeOwner

      public void changeOwner(ShopOwner currentOwner, ShopOwner newOwner)
      Allows the current owner of this auto shop to give this auto shop to a new owner.
      Parameters:
      currentOwner - the current owner of this auto shop
      newOwner - the new owner of this auto shop
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if currentOwner is not the current owner of this auto shop

    • add

      public void add(List<Vehicle> vehicles)
      Adds the specified vehicles to this auto shop. If any of the input vehicle already exists in the auto shop, throw an exception and do NOT add any vehicle to the shop.

      You may assume that the input list does NOT have any duplicate.

      Parameters:
      vehicles - a list of vehicles to add to this auto shop
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if any input vehicle already exists in the shop

    • contains

      public boolean contains(Vehicle vehicle)
      Returns true if this auto shop contains the specified vehicle, and false otherwise.
      Parameters:
      vehicle - a vehicle
      Returns:
      true if this auto shop contains the specified vehicle, and false otherwise

    • sellingSingleVehicle

      public Vehicle sellingSingleVehicle(ShopOwner user, Vehicle vehicle)
      Allows the owner of this auto shop to sell a single vehicle equal to the specified vehicle from this auto shop.

      If the specified user is not equal to the owner of this auto shop, then the vehicle is not sold from this auto shop, and null is returned.

      If the specified vehicle does not exist in the auto shop, then the vehicle is not sold from this auto shop, and null is returned.

      Parameters:
      user - the person trying to sell the vehicle
      vehicle - a vehicle
      Returns:
      a vehicle equal to the specified vehicle from this auto shop, or null if user is not the owner of this auto shop or the vehicle does not exist.

    • deepCopy

      public List<Vehicle> deepCopy()
      Returns a deep copy of the vehicles in this auto shop as a list. The returned list has its vehicles in sorted order (from the smallest price value to the largest price value).
      Returns:
      a deep copy of the list of vehicles in this auto shop

    • shallowCopy

      public List<Vehicle> shallowCopy()
      Returns a Shallow copy of the vehicles in this auto shop as a list. The returned list has its vehicles in sorted order (from the smallest price value to the largest price value).
      Returns:
      a show copy of the list of the vehicles in this auto shop
